p: Globally, rotavirus is the leading cause of severe diarrhea, hospitalization, and diarrhea related deaths in infants and children younger than 5 years old [ 1]. Before the introduction of rotavirus vaccines in 2006, rotavirus caused an estimated 200,000 emergency room visits, 55,000 to 70,000 hospitalizations, and 20 to 60 deaths annually in children younger than 5 years of age, leading to approximately $1 billion in direct and indirect costs to the U.S. [ 2].
